screen_name: #COVID19 7/8 I take frequent naps & spent a few days sleeping. My goal was to stay out of hospital. This is day 14 & still coughing, 1 nap/day. From 4-6am is brutal b/c I need inhalers. I then cough for about 30 min. & fall back asleep for a bit. The rest of my day is better now.

#COVID19 2/8 Even though I was fairly certain of results, hearing it is jarring. Here is my story. I had a bit of an allergy-like cough 3/16 & 17 - nothing alarming & at that time my car was covered in fresh pollen. I also had a constant dull headache which I don’t usually get.

#COVID19 6/8 My husband suggested constant cool humidifier & that helped. Vick’s vaporub on chest in morning & evening was soothing & helped suppress the cough. By 3/20 my doc added a nebulizer with albuterol (my coughing was worse & I had some mild chest pains) and a z-pack.

#COVID19 5/8 My doc helped keep me calm & focused on solutions. I take a Dulera inhaler whenever I have allergy issues which I started at 1st sign of a cough. Also take singular daily. Doc added mucinex night & day & a “rescue” inhaler of ventolin.

#COVID19 4/8 On 3/22, I went to drive through testing site. Earlier restrictions of a minimum temp had been lifted & if you had symptoms you could get tested. Test results took 7 days to come back. I was in touch with my internist by email once I started fever.

#COVID19 3/8 On 3/18, I started with a low grade fever. Temp was 99.2-100.2 from 3/18-22. I did not sleep comfortably @ night due to coughing & anxiety. The exhaustion is an indescribable level. Also had significant pain in right side under my lower ribs, no appetite & diarrhea.

#COVID19 3/8 On 3/18, I started with a low grade fever. Temp was 99.2-100.2 from 3/18-22. I did not sleep comfortably @ night due to coughing & anxiety. The exhaustion is an indescribable level. Also had significant pain in right side under my lower ribs, no appetite & diarrhea.

#COVID19 2/8 Even though I was fairly certain of results, hearing it is jarring. Here is my story. I had a bit of an allergy-like cough 3/16 & 17 - nothing alarming & at that time my car was covered in fresh pollen. I also had a constant dull headache which I don’t usually get.

#COVID19 1/8 Here goes..... I actually never share personal medical issues on social media, but these are different times and if this post helps one person, I will feel good.
I have tested positive for COVID-19. I got the test results on Saturday.
